Should Schools Provide Free Pads and Tampons?

Have you ever experienced period shaming, or “period poverty"? Should schools step in to help? Should schools be required to provide free pads and tampons to students? How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

Should Schools Provide Free Pads and Tampons?

Have you ever experienced period shaming, or “period poverty"? Should schools step in to help? Should schools be required to provide free pads and tampons to students? How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

---

In my opinion, schools should provide free pads and tampons. I am not a female, however i cant imagine what it would feel like to be trapped in school on your period that suddenly popped up, without any sort of tampon or pad. Especially a middle school girl who may not even know what is going on down there.  At this age, i think schools should do their best to make sure that the girls are supported in this way. Schools can be rough, and it would stink to have a girl get made fun of for something like this she could not control. Im not saying that you need to put the pads or tampons in a vending machine or something like that, but i think every school nurse should have them to hand out in case a girl needs them. I would say that pads and tampons are similar to toilet paper, soap, and band aids because they are all essential type of products. What is a girl suppose to do if there were no such thing as tampons. She would probably have to just stick toilet paper or something in there. I dont think tampons and pads are overly expensive so there is really no reason why schools wouldnt be able to provide them and just buy them in bulk.

So in conclusion, i personally feel that tampons and pads should both be provided in schools for free.
